content: NEW YORK  June 13 The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday said federal judges should have more discretion to boost penalties in patent infringement cases and ordered a lower appeals court to review whether Zimmer Biomet Holdings Inc  willfully violated Stryker Corp patents on a surgical cleaning wand.
name: Zimmer Biomet Holdings Inc
title: Stryker  Halo to get second chance at enhanced patent damages

content: NEW YORK  June 14 Medical device maker Biomet Inc breached a deferred prosecution agreement it reached in 2012 to resolve a foreign corruption investigation  U.S. prosecutors said in a court filing.
name: Zimmer Biomet Holdings Inc
title: Zimmer Biomet breached deferred prosecution deal  U.S. says

content: March 27 Shares of hip  knee and shoulder replacement maker Zimmer Biomet Holdings could rise 25 percent as the market sees signs that the company is recovering from merger indigestion  according to an article in the latest edition of Barron's.

title: Zimmer Biomet shares could rise 25 pct - Barron's

content: March 25 Zimmer Biomet Holdings Inc said on Friday a U.S.  investigation into foreign bribes at Biomet  before it was acquired by Zimmer  would continue past a deferred prosecution agreement deadline of March 26.
name: Zimmer Biomet Holdings Inc
title: Probe into Biomet bribery charges to continue past DPA deadline

content: Indiana-based medical device manufacturer Zimmer Biomet Holdings Inc  on Friday was cleared of liability in the first of more than 900 U.S. lawsuits to go to trial over claims that its NexGen Flex knee replacements were prone to painful  motion-impairing loosening.
name: Zimmer Biomet Holdings Inc
title: Zimmer wins first U.S. trial over NexGen Flex knee devices

content: Nov 6 Indiana-based medical device manufacturer Zimmer Biomet Holdings Inc on Friday was cleared of liability in the first of more than 900 U.S. lawsuits to go to trial over claims that its NexGen Flex knee replacements were prone to painful  motion-impairing loosening.
name: Zimmer Biomet Holdings Inc
title: Zimmer wins first U.S. trial over NexGen Flex knee devices

content: WASHINGTON  Oct 19 The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday agreed to consider whether a $70 million jury award that Stryker Corp won against Zimmer Biomet Holdings Inc for patent infringement should be tripled.
name: Zimmer Biomet Holdings Inc
title: U.S. top court to hear Stryker appeal in Zimmer patent suit

content: Zimmer  an Indiana-based medical device manufacturer  is set to face the first trial amid nearly 1 000 lawsuits in federal court alleging that its NexGen Flex knee implants have a defect that make them prone to loosening  which can cause pain and a loss of movement.
name: Zimmer Biomet Holdings Inc
title: First trial set for Zimmer's NexGen Flex knee implant litigation
